TopicTitle: Explorer 2 - The Epic Journey of a Satellite

Articles.Content: Explorer 1 was in solar orbit, when it picked up an unknown noise. It sounded like there were dolphins, but in space? Something was up. Explorer 2, which was planned to go into a low solar orbit, was launched. It now had a second objective, which was to find the space dolphins. Upon getting a high apoapsis, while burning to enter orbit, the noise was experienced again. The second objective was considered complete. During the Kerbin escape burn, it ended up having a Mun flyby. Sadly, it didn't enter Mun orbit. It is now in Kerbin orbit, and will soon prepare to have a Kerbin escape burn.

BIG NEWS: Explorer 2 has reached Kerbin escape! Tomorrow it will begin its retrograde to low solar orbit!

Picture of Explorer 2, Kerbin, and Explorer 1.

Explorer 2 has now entered a solar orbit that crosses Eve's orbit! There isn't much fuel left, but Explorer 2 will continue its descent later!

Explorer 2 burning.

During a burn to get closer to the sun, Explorer 2 ran out of fuel. Its journey has come to an end.

Explorer 2's final burn.
